body_html:
@alextp hi!

I checked tensor array ops' code, and found some very expensive operations, like:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_array_ops.cc

Lines 1329 to 1331 in 81161f9

functor::Split<Device, T, 3>()(ctx->eigen_device<Device>(),
tensor_value_i_t, tensor_value_t,
indices, sizes);

I modify the code and let the split act as trivial, then the total running time reduces to about 30s with the same device.

Maybe a fused_split can help with performance.
body_text:
@alextp hi!
I checked tensor array ops' code, and found some very expensive operations, like:

  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_array_ops.cc

           functor::Split<Device, T, 3>()(ctx->eigen_device<Device>(), 
        

        
          
                                          tensor_value_i_t, tensor_value_t, 
        

        
          
                                          indices, sizes); 
        
    
  


I modify the code and let the split act as trivial, then the total running time reduces to about 30s with the same device.
Maybe a fused_split can help with performance.
body:
@alextp hi!

I checked tensor array ops' code, and found some very expensive operations, like:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/81161f9d9987a8eb70793d95048c20be34292859/tensorflow/core/kernels/tensor_array_ops.cc#L1329-L1331

I modify the code and let the split act as trivial, then the total running time reduces to about 30s with the same device.

Maybe a fused_split can help with performance.
